headline: Amazon Prime Day Sales Off 41% First Day, Brand Adviser Says
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Amazon.com Inc took a big gamble this year by expanding its annual Prime Day summer sale to four days from two, betting the extension would give shoppers more time to navigate the millions of deals on its sprawling web store.Most Read from BloombergSinger Akon’s Failed Futuristic City in Senegal Ends Up a $1 Billion ResortAre Tourists Ruining Europe? headline: 3 Dividend Stocks to Double Up on Right Now
summary: Realty Income is a REIT that boasts stable income and a monthly dividend.  Target has been battered by a tough economy, but the retailer should see a recovery.  Credit card powerhouse American Express has begun resonating with younger consumers.

headline: Taiwan Semiconductor and Cloudflare have been highlighted as Zacks Bull and Bear of the Day
summary: TSMC surges on AI chip demand, while Cloudflare stumbles under lofty valuations and weak EPS momentum.

headline: Retailers extend summer sales in battle for bargain-hunting consumers
summary: These moves reflect retailers’ efforts to gain an edge in a competitive market shaped by economic uncertainty, potential import tariffs, and changing consumer expectations.
